title: US and UK pulling some personnel from Qatar military base
desc: US officials say it is a "precautionary measure" and comes as Donald Trump weighs up whether to take action against Iran.

title: Starlink reportedly made free in Iran - but protesters are taking huge risks by using it
desc: The satellite technology has become a vital communications lifeline after the government shut down the internet last week.

title: At least 32 killed after crane collapses on train in Thailand
desc: Sixty-four people were left injured, including a one-year-old and an 85-year-old.

title: Trump administration pauses immigrant visa processing for 75 countries
desc: The pause starting on 21 January will bar foreign nationals who "would take welfare and public benefits".

title: US launches phase two of Gaza peace plan with new technocratic government
desc: It includes the establishment of a technocratic Palestinian government, as well as the reconstruction and demilitarisation of Gaza, US envoy Steve Witkoff says.

title: Italian influencer Chiara Ferragni cleared of cake fraud
desc: Chiara Ferragni had been accused of misleading consumers in her promotion of Christmas cakes and Easter eggs.

title: 'Appropriate and unambiguous': White House defends Trump over middle-finger gesture at heckler
desc: Thousands of people have sent donations totalling nearly $700,000 (£521,000) to the heckler, who was suspended from his job at Ford.

title: Swiss regions ban pyrotechnics after ski bar fire
desc: The blaze is believed to have started when sparklers attached to champagne bottles set foam padding on the ceiling alight.

title: FBI searches home of Washington Post reporter in classified documents probe
desc: Attorney General Bondi accused the journalist of reporting classified information allegedly leaked by a federal contractor, who she said has been arrested.

title: Amateur stuns world's best to win A$1m in Melbourne
desc: Amateur Jordan Smith is the shock winner of the Million Dollar One Point Slam at the Australian Open, beating reigning men's champion Jannik Sinner along the way.

title: Uganda election chief says he has had threats over results declaration
desc: This follows comments by a presidential assistant that Bobi Wine would not be declared president, even if he wins.

title: LA opens ticket draw for 2028 Olympics - with seats starting at $28
desc: If chosen via the draw, fans will be notified via email and will be given a time slot to purchase tickets in April.

title: Russian doctors arrested after 9 babies die in maternity hospital
desc: The newborns died during the long New Year holiday in a Siberian hospital.

title: K-pop drum duet between Japan and South Korea's leaders caps off summit talks
desc: Leaders of the two East Asian nations played drums to hits from BTS and KPop Demon Hunters.

title: Tehran morgue videos show the brutality of Iran's crackdown on protesters
desc: Distressing footage reveals nearly 200 bodies with one victim identified as young as 16.

title: Why two Canadian provinces are in a spat over Crown Royal whisky
desc: The UK-owned, Canadian-made whisky is testing a united "Team Canada" approach in the face of US tariffs.

title: Dubai chocolate-inspired dessert takes S Korea by storm
desc: Shops are selling hundreds of cookies within minutes as the frenzy sends prices of ingredients surging.

title: No power or water and -19C: Kyiv seeks relief from Russian strikes and cold
desc: Residents of Ukraine's capital talk about their difficulties keeping warm and enduring power outages, as Russian attacks deepen the energy crisis.

title: Bowen: Authoritarian regimes die gradually then suddenly, but Iran is not there yet
desc: The regime's opponents will hope for more pressure to accelerate the process, writes the BBC's international editor.

title: Canada's Mark Carney faces delicate balancing act in China visit
desc: The PM is seeking to deepen trade and repair ties with China after years of tense relations - without compromising national security or provoking the US.

title: 'Welcome to 2976' - North Africa's Amazigh people ring in the new year
desc: The Amazigh calendar places them almost a thousand years ahead of much of the rest of the world.

title: 'Grim scene': BBC on site after crane collapses on train in Thailand
desc: Correspondent Jonathan Head says the 'devastating' accident is an enormous setback for Thailand's efforts to modernise its infrastructure.

title: Trump vows 'very strong action' if Iran executes protesters
desc: Relatives of 26-year-old Erfan Soltani, who was detained last week, have told BBC Persian he is due to be executed on Wednesday.

title: What message do Greenlanders have for Trump?
desc: The BBC's Europe editor Katya Adler hears from Greenlanders, whose island is embroiled in a geopolitical storm.

title: 'Now there's the threat of executions' in Iran
desc: An Iranian security official says 2,000 people have been killed so far after a crackdown on weeks of anti-government protests.

title: Mortuary videos show how deadly Iran crackdown has become
desc: BBC Verify has been examining disturbing footage from a mortuary in Tehran, showing scores of bodies. These images could hold clues about what’s happening inside Iran.

title: Watch: Moment skier and dog swept along by avalanche
desc: Footage recorded by Spanish skier Ares Masip shows the incident on Pic de l'Hortell, a mountain in Andorra.
